p: Changes in species abundance during the study period are related to climatic conditions ( Fig. 5). With some exceptions, species located in higher temperature and precipitation climatic space experienced reductions in abundance, as indicated by the speciesâ€™ density change. On the other hand, species located in the lower temperature and precipitation climatic space experienced increases ( Fig. 5A). Among 38 species associated with mean temperature and precipitation less than the median values (the lower left part of Fig. 5A), 84% experienced an increase in their total stem density.
